titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the R. G. Davis Papers Relating to Dario Fo
Davis (R. G.) Papers Relating to Dario Fo
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday May 4, 2019 at 03:46

did.unittitle: R. G. Davis papers relating to Dario Fo

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

langmaterial.language: Materials in English, Italian, and French.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Andover Street Archives on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2017.

bioghist.head: Dario Fo
bioghist.p: Dario Fo (1926-2016) was an Italian dramatist, theater producer and director, actor, singer, composer, artist, and political activist. He received the 1997 Nobel Prize in Literature.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: R. G. Davis Papers Relating to Dario Fo. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: The R. G. Davis papers relating to Dario Fo, which span from 1950-2017, contain correspondence, writings, printed material, photographs, audiocassettes, audiovisual materials, and other papers by or relating to Dario Fo.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The R. G. Davis Papers Relating to Dario Fo is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

Also contains Resolutions Committee, Leisure Time and the Arts, 26th Constitutional Convention, UAW, pamphlet (1980 June), an annoucement from The Labor Theater regarding "Left Out Lady" (1981 January 12), handwritten notes, a flyer from The Labor Theater regarding "Railroad Bill," a photoprint from the Seattle production of "We Won't Pay," newpaper and magazine clippings, and handouts regarding We Won't Pay! at the Old Spaghetti Factory (1983).
